THE CHAPTER 22.2.3 IS UPDATED ACCORDINGLY: 22.2.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK ORLY AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME AND ESTIMED LANDING TIME, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN-ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DIFFERENT TYPES OF DPI AND API ARE: -GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) -PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (P-DPI) -EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) -TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) -ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) -CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER TO BE USED REA AS IT IS REPLACED BY DPI MESSSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. REF AIP AD2 22.2.3

SX0089/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFPB/PARIS/LE BOURGET MODIFICATION AIP FRANCE AD2 LFPB REGARDING SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC FM PARIS - LE BOURGET FURTHER TO PTV VOR AND NDB POY EXTINCTION VALIDITY: 13JUN24- 30OCT24 VOR PTV FM THE 12/29/2022 RPLC BY THE WPT (5LNC) OLZOM, NDB POY FM 15/06/23 RPLC BY WPT OXCEL. RESULTS IN THE MODIFICATION OF THE SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC BASED ON THIS AID.TEMPO OPR PROC ARE IMPLEMENTED IN ORDER TO HANDLE THE SB DEP ACFT, WHILE AWAITING THE DESIGN OF NEW RNAV STD INITIAL DEP PROC - ALL SID PTV DEP LFPB ARE REMOVED. - ALL SIDS USING POY DEP FM LE BOURGET ARE AFFECTED BY THE EXTINCTION OF NDB POY. SOME INITIAL PARTS OF SID MONOT AND DORDI DEP FM LFPB ARE NOT AFFECTED AND THEREFORE REMAIN USABLE.THE NEW WP OXCEL REPLACES POY AND MUST BE INPUT IN NAVIGATION SYSTEMS OF AIRPLANES DEPARTING FROM LE BOURGET THAT USE THESE ROUTES. ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5J IN FORCE - SID CONV MONOT 5J NOT USABLE - SID DORDI 5J REMAINS USABLE - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM OR MONOT - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN PCD DCT OLZOM OR MONOT COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5M IN FORCE - SID DORDI 5M NOT USABLE - SID MONOT 5M REMAINS USABLE IN ITS INITIAL PART UP TO RADIAL 073 TSU INCLUDED. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190 TOWARDS OXCEL, THEN PCD DCT TO OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 25 TO OLZOM / MONOT/ DORDI WITH SID LFPB 5C AND 5F IN FORCE - PARTS OF SID MONOT 5C / 5F AND DORDI 5C / 5F ARE NO LONGER USABLE AFT 12 NM FM BT. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON RADIAL BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG 123 THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE: SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, PCD DCT OXCEL THEN DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI W WITH SID 5C AND 5F - DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG TRACK 123, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL , THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT DCT OXCEL THEN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************************* DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI E WITH SID 5J -DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB 3000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB093, INTERCEPT MLN 360 RADIAL, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600. FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB 3000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB093, INTERCEPT MLN 360 RADIAL, THEN AT 17.1 NM FM MLN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE *************************************************** DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI E WITH SID 5M -DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB FL 070, THEN ENR TO PB093, TURN RIGHT TO INTERCEPT TSU 073 RADIAL, THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600. FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB FL 070, THEN ENR TO PB093, TURN RIGHT TO INTERCEPT TSU 073 RADIAL, THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT DCT OXCEL THEN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE. ********************************************* MODIFICATION TO AD2 LFPB 2.22.3.4 PILOTS MUST APPLY THE FLW PROC : SPECIFY PLN BOX 15 : - FOR DEP TO OLZOM : DCT OLZOM (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY) - FOR ALL MONOT EXIT DEP : DCT MONOT (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY) - FOR ALL DORDI EXIT DEP : DCT DORDI (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY)

DPI AND API ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. INSTEAD OF : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

TWY P WILL BE CLSD BTN TWYS P4 AND N11 DRG THIS PERIOD. THE JUNCTIONS LEADING TO TWYS P4, P6, P8, P10 AND P14 TO THE E WILL BE MARKED AS CLSD BY MEANS OF RED STOP BAR LGT. AFT LDG ON RWY 07L/25R, ACCESS TO THE APN WILL EXCLUSIVELY BE VIA TWY P1. IN DEV FM THE SPECIFIED TIMES OF THE WINTER SER SEASON, IT WILL NO LONGER BE POSS TO USE DEICING PADS 1 AND 2 UNDER ANY WEATHER COND FM THE TIME THE EASTERN TWY BRIDGES ARE CLSD. - OPR DIRECTION 25: ALL TAX TFC (INBD) FM RWY 25R WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS P1, N-N, N15 AND ONWARDS VIA TWY L TO THE E. ALL TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) WILL BE CONDUCTED ACCORDING TO THE STD. - OPR DIRECTION 07: ALL TAX TFC (INBD) FM RWY 07L WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS P1, N-N, N15 AND ONWARDS VIA TWY N TO THE E. TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWY L ACCORDING TO THE STD. PILOTS WHO ARE UNA TO ACPT A TKOF RUN ON RWY 18 AFT GUIDANCE FM TWY L SHALL NOTIFY APN CTL IN GOOD TIME. IN THIS CASE, TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS L, Y AND N. THE TRANSFER OF TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 BTN APN CTL AND THE TWR IS CONDUCTED IN FRONT OF TWY L20. ALTERNATIVELY, ACFT CAN ALSO BE ROUTED VIA TWYS L, N15 AND N. ACFT TURNING E ONTO TWY N FM TWY N15 (COMING FM THE N) DO NOT CONFLICT WITH ACFT TURNING W ONTO TWY N FM TWY N15 (COMING FM THE S). - TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 07C WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWY L. ACFT UP TO ICAO CAT MEDIUM FOR WHICH AN INT TKOF IS REQ WITH APN CTL WILL BE TRANSFERRED TO THE TWR IN GOOD TIME. PILOTS SHOULD INFORM THE TWR AS EARLY AS WITH THE START-UP APPROVAL WHETHER THEY ACPT AN INT TKOF 07C. FOR OPR DIRECTION 07, SULU DEP MIGHT BE PROACTIVELY MOV FM RWY 07C TO RWY 18. - THE IMPORTANCE OF THE PUBLISHED HIRO PROC WHICH REQUIRES VACATING THE RWY AS QUICKLY AS POSS AFT LDG, BEING READY FOR TKOF AT THE RWY WHEN DEP, AND TAX OFF IMT UPON RECEIPT OF THE TKOF CLR. IN GEN, ALL ACFT OF CATEGORIES MEDIUM AND LGT DEP FM RWY 18 SHOULD ALSO PREPARE FOR A TKOF FM TWY M OR TWY S. CONTRARY TO AD 2.20 EDDF SECTION 5.3, ALL ACFT PARKED ON ACFT STANDS E OF TWY N4 SHALL EXP TO TAX TO RWY 18 VIA TWYS U, T, R AND S. THE EXACT CLSD HR AND CLSD AREAS OF THE TWY CONCERNED WILL BE ANNOUNCED VIA NOTAM

DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

SX0021/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT EDDS/STUTTGART VALIDITY: 03JUN24 - 20SEP24 THE CONCRETE SURFACE OF TWY N BTN TWY A AND TWY B WILL BE REPLACED. DURING THE CONSTRUCTION WORK, THE FOLLOWING RESTRICTIONS AND CHANGES WILL APPLY: - TWY N WILL BE CLSD BTN TWY A AND TWY D. IN ADDITION, TWY A AND TWY B WILL BE CLSD BTN TWY N AND TWY S. - THE BYPASS AREAS P1 AND P2 WILL BE CLSD. - IN THE SECTION OF TWY S ADJACENT TO THE CONSTRUCTION SITE, TAXIING IS RESTRICTED TO ACFT UP TO A MAXIMUM WINGSPAN OF 76 M. - UNUSABLE PORTIONS OF TAXIWAYS WILL EITHER HAVE THEIR NORMAL MARKINGS REMOVED OR WILL BE MARKED ACCORDINGLY. - THE ENTIRE CONSTRUCTION AREA WILL BE MARKED/LIGHTED DURING THE DAY AND AT NIGHT. IN UNFAVOURABLE METEOROLOGICAL CONDITIONS (DRY AND WINDY), THE LARGE-SCALE CONSTRUCTION WORK MAY CAUSE VISIBLE ACCUMULATIONS OF DUST. THE AIRPORT OPERATOR WILL TAKE PREVENTIVE MEASURES TO KEEP THIS AT A MINIMUM. FURTHER OPERATIONAL RESTRICTIONS WILL BE PUBLISHED BY NOTAM.

AIRCRAFT WITH RADIO FAILURE MUST OPERATE AS FOLLOWS: DEPARTING AIRCRAFT CONTINUE STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. ARRIVING AIRCRAFT - IF HAS ALREADY RECEIVED TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS, CONTINUES STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE, TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND OR, IF HAS BEEN INSTRUCTED PROCEED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IN ANY CASE NO TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED: - IF IT RECEIVES SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS, VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, IT CLEARS THE LANDING AREA AND WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF IT DOES NOT RECEIVE THESE INSTRUCTIONS VIA LIGHT SIGNALS (FOR EXAMPLE IN THE CASE OF REDUCED VISIBILITY) IT STOPS ON THE RUNWAY, AT THE FIRST AVAILABLE LINK, AND IN ANY CASE BASED ON ANY KNOWN RESTRICTIONS, WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. NOTE: THE INSTRUCTION TO CLEAR THE LANDING AREA, PROVIDED VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, DOES NOT IMPLY CONSTRAINTS ON THE ROUTE TO FOLLOW AND THEREFORE CAN ONLY BE USED WHEN COMPATIBLE WITH THE TRAFFIC SITUATION IN PROGRESS IN THE MANEUVERING AREA REF AIP AD 2 LIPK 1-13
ATS AND MET OBS ADDITIONALLY PROVIDED. REF AIP AD 2 LIPK 1-1 AND GEN 3.5-19

SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.

AX0002/20 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR THE PILOT OF THE AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN THE LIBYAN AIR SPACE A. THE LIBYAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY STRESSES THE PILOT OF AIRCRAFT OPERATING OUTSIDE THE FIELD OF HIGH COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE NECESSITY OF USING VHF/ RT RANGE .RADIO FREQUENCY ASSIGNED TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION BETWEEN PILOTS VHF AIR / AIR VOLINTARY REPORT. B. FOR MORE COORDINATION BETWEEN THE OPPOSING AIR TRAFFIC, ESPECIALLY THOSE OPERATING OUTSIDE THE CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION IN THE LIBYAN AVIATION TERRITORY AND THE MENTIONED RADIO FREQUENCIES ARE: 1- WHEN FLYING AT OR BELOW THE FLYING LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 123.5 MHZ 2- WHEN FLYING ABOVE A FLIGHT LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 126.9 MHZ C. THIS AUTHORITY ALSO STRESSES THE NEED TO OBTAIN PRIOR PERMISSION FOR FLIGHTS BEFORE TAKING OFF FROM AIRPORTS THAT ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THE MAJOR AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL CENTERS IN TRIPOLI AND ITS BRANCH IN BENGHAZI BY WAY OF HIGH-FREQUENCY RADIO
